channel.title: BibTeXML updates
channel.description: News, updates and changes related to BibTeX in XML.

item.title: Java GUI application for BibTeX conversion
item.description: BibTeXConverter, a Java GUI application for BibTeX conversion developed by Moritz Ringler, is now part of this project.

item.title: BibTeXML Subversion repository
item.description: We've (finally) imported BibTeXML code to the SVN repository on sourceforge.net.

item.title: Minor BibTeXML update
item.description: We have released a new pre-release of BibTeXML. Changes: Character encoding fix. encoding="utf-8" in output from bibtex2xml.py Test case provided.

item.title: Updates
item.description: We have released a new pre-release of BibTeXML. Changes: Replaced bibtex2xml.py with Sara E. Sprenkle's rewrite. Many new XSLT style sheets for output to HTML or LaTeX with Harvard, Chicago and APA citation styles, and output to Dublin Core RDF, MODS XML and RIS.

item.title: bibutils: BibTeX to MODS XML
item.description: There is really no point in using tools provided with BibTeXML for converting to MODS, because the bibliography conversion utilities provided by bibutils are much better. From BibTeX, RIS, EndNote, ISI, Pubmed, COPAC to MODS XML and output to BibTeX, RIS, EndNote. Binaries available for all common operating systems. (Then use CiteProc or BiblioX to typeset MODS.)

item.title: How-to: Citation styles
item.description: PDFs with tutorials on how to write references according to standard citation systems like Harvard, AGPS, Chicago, APA, and their common uses.

item.title: Changes: web page and mailing lists
item.description: We have updated the web pages a bit, and "deleted" the old bibtexml-general mailing list in favor of a new bibtexml-users list.

item.title: Updated BibTeX2HTML link
item.description: Sara E. Sprenkle reports she has moved the BibTeX2HTML package to another server.

item.title: Download from sf.net File Release System
item.description: Download are now available through the SourceForge.net File Release System. (Something I should have bothered learning how to do a long time ago.) Next: Learn how to set up CVS, and create a "final" release for the schemas.

item.title: RELAX NG Schemas
item.description: Added RELAX NG versions of the Schemas for BibTeX. Release candidate quality. bibtexml-ext.rnc provides a slightly different markup than bibtexml-ext.dtd.

item.title: XSL transformation back to BibTeX
item.description: Updated bibtexml2bibtex.xsl and bibtexml-ext2bibtex.xsl, more XSLTs will be fixed in the near future.

item.title: Bibliography overview
item.description: Bruce D'Arcus and John J. Lee have put together a list of "Open standards and software for bibliographies and cataloging."

item.title: Bugfix: DTD
item.description: A minor bug fix to bibteXML-ext.dtd. (Typos!)

item.title: Parameterized DTD
item.description: The bibtexml DTD has been rewritten, now fully modular, with possibilities to plug in other DTDs, modify sections of it, change the namespace prefix.
